intro: Thalictrum thamnophilum, commonly known as the meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Thalictrum thamnophilum is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
